material.mattext: Most of the chemical reactions that directly produce free energy in living systems are of what type?
Energy is stored long-term in the bonds of _____ and used short-term to perform work from a(n) _____ molecule.
removes a hydrogen atom from the substrate
reduces the compound to a simpler form
adds an electron to the substrate

Select the most appropriate word from the list below to complete the following paragraph: Respiration is the release of A from B and takes place in all C of the body. In the course of respiration, B is broken down to D and E . If oxygen is used for this process, the respiration is called F If oxygen is not used in the process, the respiration is called G. Each stage of respiration is speeded up by a particular H .
During the second half of glycolysis, what occurs?
What is removed from pyruvate during its conversion into an acetyl group?
the movement of hydrogen atoms across a mitochondrial membrane
the movement of electrons across the cell membrane
the movement of hydrogen ions across a mitochondrial membrane
How many NADH molecules are produced for each molecule of glucose that proceeds to the citric acid cycle?
The energy currency used by cells is ________.
The two main types of anaerobic cellular respiration are lactic acid fermentation and
Which of the following fermentation methods can occur in animal skeletal muscles?
Select the type of organisms that can perform both aerobic respiration and lactic fermentation.
The light-independent reactions of photosynthesis occur in the stroma of chloroplasts and consist of what three steps?
photosystem I; photosystem II; and cytochrome complex
â€‹Which of the following is the only biological process in which energy from light is transformed into chemical energy within cells?
The only organisms capable of photosynthesis are plants, cyanobacteria, and ________.
Plants use light energy to drive the formation of carbon-rich sugars via photosynthesis, using what as a source of carbon?
â€‹â€‹The essential molecular structure in plants that converts light energy into chemical energy during photosynthesis is called a ________.
What two main products result from photosynthesis?
